Keywords: primary, CTA, action, submit, main action
Description: Primary button for main call-to-action with clear visual hierarchy and distinct styling
Do: Use high-contrast background with clear text; min 44x44px touch target; provide hover/focus/active states
Don't: Use primary button for every action; skip focus ring; use low-contrast colors
Code Example Good: <button className="rounded-lg bg-blue-600 px-6 py-3 text-sm font-semibold text-white shadow-sm transition-colors hover:bg-blue-500 focus-visible:outline focus-visible:outline-2 focus-visible:outline-offset-2 focus-visible:outline-blue-600">Submit</button>
Accessibility: role=button implicit; use aria-label when text is ambiguous; visible focus-visible ring; keyboard Enter/Space triggers
Responsive: Min width 120px on mobile; full-width on xs screens; min height 44px touch target

Description: Secondary button for alternative actions that complement the primary CTA
Do: Use outline or muted style clearly distinct from primary; maintain same sizing as primary
Don't: Make secondary button visually compete with primary; use same colors as primary
Code Example Good: <button className="rounded-lg border border-zinc-300 bg-white px-6 py-3 text-sm font-semibold text-zinc-900 shadow-sm transition-colors hover:bg-zinc-50 focus-visible:outline focus-visible:outline-2 focus-visible:outline-offset-2 focus-visible:outline-zinc-600 dark:border-zinc-700 dark:bg-zinc-800 dark:text-zinc-100">Cancel</button>
Accessibility: Same keyboard support as primary; clear visual distinction for screen readers via context
Responsive: Same sizing rules as primary button; maintain consistent padding

Description: Ghost/text button for low-emphasis actions like tertiary navigation or inline actions
Do: Use transparent background with text color; show subtle hover background; keep consistent padding
Don't: Remove all visual affordance making it indistinguishable from text; skip hover state
Code Example Good: <button className="rounded-lg px-4 py-2 text-sm font-medium text-zinc-600 transition-colors hover:bg-zinc-100 hover:text-zinc-900 focus-visible:outline focus-visible:outline-2 focus-visible:outline-offset-2 focus-visible:outline-zinc-600 dark:text-zinc-400 dark:hover:bg-zinc-800 dark:hover:text-zinc-100">Learn more</button>
Accessibility: Must still be focusable with visible focus ring; aria-label if text is ambiguous
Responsive: Increase padding on touch devices for better tap targets

Description: Icon-only button for compact actions like close, menu toggle, or settings
Do: Always provide aria-label; use consistent square dimensions; include tooltip on hover
Don't: Use icon button without aria-label; make icons too small to tap; skip tooltip
Code Example Good: <button aria-label="Close dialog" className="rounded-lg p-2 text-zinc-400 transition-colors hover:bg-zinc-100 hover:text-zinc-600 focus-visible:outline focus-visible:outline-2 focus-visible:outline-offset-2 focus-visible:outline-zinc-600"><XMarkIcon className="h-5 w-5" /></button>
Accessibility: aria-label required; tooltip for sighted users; keyboard accessible; 44x44px minimum touch area
Responsive: Min 44x44px on all screens; consider adding text label on larger screens

Description: Button with loading state during async operations to prevent double submissions
Do: Disable button and show spinner during loading; preserve button width to prevent layout shift; use aria-busy
Don't: Allow double clicks during async operations; change button width when loading; hide all text during load
Accessibility: aria-busy=true during loading; keep readable text alongside spinner; announce state change to screen readers
Responsive: Maintain fixed button width to prevent layout shift on mobile

Description: Group of related buttons displayed together as a cohesive unit
Do: Use consistent sizing within group; add proper spacing or connected borders; use role=group with aria-label
Don't: Mix different button sizes in a group; use inconsistent spacing; skip group labeling
Accessibility: role=group with aria-label; arrow key navigation between group items; roving tabindex pattern
Responsive: Stack vertically on narrow screens; maintain full-width on mobile

Description: Modal dialog with backdrop overlay for focused user interaction requiring attention
Do: Use dialog element or role=dialog; trap focus inside modal; close on Escape key; close on backdrop click; restore focus on close
Don't: Auto-open modals on page load; allow scroll behind modal; forget to return focus; nest modals deeply
Code Example Good:
Confirm Action

Are you sure?
Code Example Bad: e.stopPropagation()}>Content
Accessibility: role=dialog; aria-labelledby for title; aria-describedby for description; focus trap; Escape to close; restore focus on close
Responsive: Max-width 90vw on mobile; full-screen on xs; bottom sheet pattern on mobile if appropriate

Description: Focus management within modal to keep keyboard navigation contained inside the dialog
Do: Trap Tab and Shift+Tab within modal boundaries; auto-focus first focusable element; return focus to trigger on close
Don't: Allow Tab to escape modal; focus behind the modal; skip auto-focus on open
Code Example Good:
const FocusTrap = ({ children }) => { const ref = useRef(null); useEffect(() => { const focusable = ref.current?.querySelectorAll('button, [href], input, select, textarea, [tabindex]:not([tabindex="-1"])'); const first = focusable?.[0]; const last = focusable?.[focusable.length - 1]; first?.focus(); const handler = (e) => { if (e.key === 'Tab') { if (e.shiftKey && document.activeElement === first) { e.preventDefault(); last?.focus(); } else if (!e.shiftKey && document.activeElement === last) { e.preventDefault(); first?.focus(); } } }; ref.current?.addEventListener('keydown', handler); return () => ref.current?.removeEventListener('keydown', handler); }, []); return
{children}
; }
Code Example Bad:
{children}
// No focus management at all
Accessibility: Critical for keyboard users; prevents focus from reaching background content; WCAG 2.4.3 Focus Order
Responsive: Same behavior on all screen sizes; ensure virtual keyboard does not obscure focused inputs on mobile

Description: Confirmation dialog for destructive or irreversible actions requiring explicit user consent
Do: Use clear warning language; make destructive action visually distinct (red); default focus on safe action (Cancel)
Don't: Default focus on destructive button; use vague language; skip confirmation for irreversible actions
Code Example Good:
Delete Project?

This action cannot be undone. All data will be permanently removed.
Accessibility: aria-describedby for warning message; autoFocus on Cancel (safe action); clear destructive language
Responsive: Full-width buttons stacked on mobile; adequate spacing between confirm and cancel

Description: Proper modal dismissal patterns including keyboard, backdrop click, and explicit close button
Do: Support Escape key; close on backdrop click for non-critical modals; always show visible close button; confirm before closing if form has changes
Don't: Close without saving unsaved work; remove Escape key support; hide the close button
Code Example Good: <dialog onClose={handleClose}><button onClick={onClose} aria-label="Close" className="absolute right-4 top-4 rounded-lg p-1 text-zinc-400 hover:text-zinc-600"><XMarkIcon className="h-5 w-5" /></button>{children}</dialog> // Plus Escape handler and backdrop click
Code Example Bad: Content only, no close button, no keyboard handler
Accessibility: Escape key must close; close button with aria-label; announce closure to screen readers
Responsive: Close button easily tappable (44x44px); swipe-down to close on mobile modals

Description: Handling multiple modals layered on top of each other with proper z-index management
Do: Avoid nested modals when possible; if required use incremental z-index and manage focus stack; dim previous modal
Don't: Open unlimited nested modals; lose track of focus stack; use same z-index for all modals
Code Example Good: // Prefer replacing modal content instead of nesting: const [step, setStep] = useState('confirm'); return (<dialog><AnimatePresence mode="wait">{step === 'confirm' && <ConfirmStep onNext={() => setStep('details')} />}{step === 'details' && <DetailsStep onBack={() => setStep('confirm')} />}</AnimatePresence></dialog>)
Code Example Bad: <dialog><dialog><dialog>Three nested modals with no focus management</dialog></dialog></dialog>
Accessibility: Maintain focus trap stack; each level must be independently closeable via Escape; announce context changes
Responsive: Consider using full-screen flow instead of nested modals on mobile

Description: Standard text input with label, placeholder, validation, and error messaging
Do: Always pair with visible label; show validation errors below input; use appropriate input type (email, tel, url)
Don't: Use placeholder as label replacement; show errors only on submit; skip input types
Code Example Good:
{error &&

{error}

}
Accessibility: Visible label linked via htmlFor/id; aria-describedby for error; role=alert on error message; required attribute
Responsive: Full-width on mobile; appropriate virtual keyboard via inputMode; adequate font-size (16px+) to prevent zoom on iOS

Description: Multi-line text input for longer content like messages or descriptions
Do: Set reasonable min/max height; show character count if limited; auto-resize when possible
Don't: Allow infinite resizing breaking layout; skip character limit indication; use fixed tiny height
Accessibility: Label linked via htmlFor; aria-describedby for character count; announce limit approaching to screen readers
Responsive: Full-width; min-height 100px on mobile; resize handle visible; prevent zoom with 16px font

Description: Native or custom select input for choosing from a predefined list of options
Do: Use native select for simple lists; show selected value clearly; group related options with optgroup
Don't: Build custom select without keyboard support; use div-based dropdown without ARIA; hide the current value
Code Example Bad:
{selected}
{options.map(o =>
pick(o)}>{o}
)}
Accessibility: Native select is fully accessible; custom select needs role=listbox, role=option, aria-expanded, arrow key navigation
Responsive: Native select uses OS picker on mobile which is better UX; full-width on small screens

Description: Checkbox for boolean or multi-select choices with proper labeling
Do: Place label to the right of checkbox; use fieldset/legend for groups; make entire label area clickable
Don't: Use tiny checkboxes; separate label from checkbox click area; skip indeterminate state for partial selections
Code Example Good:
Notifications
{options.map(opt => ())}
Accessibility: fieldset/legend for groups; label wraps or linked to input; Space key toggles; aria-checked for custom checkboxes
Responsive: Min 44x44px tap target for checkbox + label area; adequate spacing between options

Description: Radio button group for mutually exclusive single selection from multiple options
Do: Group with fieldset/legend; pre-select a default when logical; use vertical layout for 3+ options
Don't: Allow multiple selections; skip fieldset/legend; use horizontal layout for many options
Code Example Good:
Plan
{plans.map(plan => ())}
Accessibility: fieldset/legend required; arrow keys navigate between options; only one tabstop for the group; aria-checked for custom
Responsive: Vertical stack on mobile; full-width cards for radio card pattern; adequate touch targets

Description: Toggle switch for immediate on/off boolean settings (not for forms that require submit)
Do: Use for immediate-effect settings; show current state clearly; provide label describing what the switch controls
Don't: Use switch in forms requiring submit; leave state ambiguous; skip the label
Accessibility: role=switch; aria-checked; keyboard Space to toggle; visible on/off state; label describes the setting
Responsive: Min 44px tall tap target; clearly visible state on mobile; consider adding on/off text labels

Description: File upload area supporting click-to-browse and drag-and-drop with preview
Do: Show accepted file types and size limits; provide drag-and-drop zone; show upload progress; preview uploaded files
Don't: Accept any file type silently; skip size validation; show no progress indicator; forget error states
Code Example Good:
Drag and drop or

PNG, JPG up to 10MB
Accessibility: Label linked to hidden file input; announce upload progress with aria-live; describe accepted types
Responsive: Full-width drop zone on mobile; large tap target for browse button; show file name after selection

Description: Date selection input using native or custom calendar picker
Do: Use native date input for simple cases; show format hint; validate date ranges; support keyboard navigation in custom pickers
Don't: Build custom date picker without keyboard support; ignore timezone; use ambiguous date formats
Code Example Good: Format: YYYY-MM-DD
Code Example Bad: <input placeholder="Enter date" className="border p-2" /> // No type=date, no format hint
Accessibility: Native date input is accessible by default; custom picker needs role=dialog, grid navigation, aria-selected
Responsive: Native date input uses OS date picker on mobile; full-width; adequate font size to prevent zoom

Description: Inline form validation feedback showing errors, success states, and helpful hints
Do: Show errors inline below the field; use aria-describedby linking; validate on blur and on submit; use role=alert for errors
Don't: Show errors only in a toast; use only color to indicate errors; validate only on submit; block typing
Code Example Good:
{error ?

{error}

:

Must be at least 8 characters

}
Code Example Bad: <input className={error ? 'border-red' : ''} /> // No error text, no ARIA
Accessibility: aria-invalid on input; aria-describedby linking to error message; role=alert on dynamic errors; not color-only
Responsive: Error messages visible without scrolling; adequate contrast for error text on mobile

Description: Standard content card with header, body, and optional footer for displaying grouped information
Do: Use consistent padding and border-radius; maintain visual hierarchy with title and body; keep content scannable
Don't: Overcrowd cards with too much content; use inconsistent spacing; skip visual hierarchy
Code Example Good:
Project Overview

A brief description of the project status and key metrics.

Updated 2 hours ago
Code Example Bad:
Title

Very long unstructured content dumped in a div with no spacing or hierarchy...
Accessibility: Use article element; heading hierarchy; role=region with aria-label if card is a landmark
Responsive: Consistent padding (16-24px); full-width on mobile; stack cards vertically on narrow screens

Description: Card that acts as a clickable link or trigger with hover effects and keyboard support
Do: Make entire card clickable; show hover state; use proper semantic (anchor or button); maintain focus ring
Don't: Nest focusable elements inside a clickable card creating nested interactivity; skip keyboard support
Code Example Good:
Project Name

Description of the project
Code Example Bad:
router.push('/project/123')} className="border p-4 cursor-pointer">

Title

Nested link
Accessibility: Use a or button element; avoid nested interactive elements; focus-visible ring; announce as link/button to screen readers
Responsive: Full card tap area on mobile; adequate padding for touch; hover effects only on hover-capable devices

Description: Card with featured image, title, and optional description for media-rich content display
Do: Use aspect-ratio for consistent image sizing; add alt text; lazy-load images below fold; optimize image format
Don't: Stretch images without maintaining ratio; skip alt text; load all images eagerly; use huge uncompressed images
Code Example Good:
{title}

{description}
Accessibility: alt text on images; article element; lazy loading with loading=lazy; decorative images use alt=''
Responsive: aspect-ratio for consistent sizing; full-width on mobile; responsive images with srcset

Description: Pricing card displaying plan name, price, features, and CTA for product pricing sections
Do: Highlight recommended plan; align feature lists across cards; use clear CTA hierarchy; show price prominently
Don't: Hide the price; use inconsistent layouts between plans; skip feature comparison alignment
Code Example Good:
Popular

Pro Plan

$99/one-time

    {features.map(f => (
  • {f}
    • ))}
Accessibility: Clear heading hierarchy; features as list; CTA button with descriptive text; aria-label on ambiguous buttons
Responsive: Stack cards vertically on mobile; full-width per card; horizontal scroll or tabs for 3+ plans on small screens

Description: Primary site navigation bar fixed at the top with logo, links, and actions
Do: Use nav element with aria-label; keep to 5-7 main items; fixed/sticky positioning; show active state
Don't: Overcrowd with too many items; use div instead of nav; hide navigation entirely on mobile; skip active state
Code Example Good:
Logo
    {links.map(link => (
  • {link.label}
    • ))}
Accessibility: nav element with aria-label; aria-current=page for active link; keyboard navigable links; mobile menu with focus trap
Responsive: Collapse to hamburger menu on mobile; sticky on scroll; adequate touch targets in mobile menu

Description: Vertical sidebar navigation for dashboards and admin interfaces with collapsible sections
Do: Use nav element; show active state; support collapsible sections; provide toggle for mobile; show icons + text
Don't: Auto-collapse hiding labels permanently; nest too many levels deep; use horizontal scrolling
Code Example Good:
{items.map(item => (
  • {item.label}
    • ))}
Accessibility: nav with aria-label; aria-current=page; keyboard navigation; expandable sections use aria-expanded
Responsive: Off-canvas drawer on mobile; overlay with backdrop; swipe to open/close; full-height on desktop

Description: Breadcrumb trail showing the user's current location within the site hierarchy
Do: Use nav with aria-label=Breadcrumb; use ol for ordered list; separate items with aria-hidden dividers; mark current page
Don't: Use breadcrumbs as primary navigation; show too many levels; make current page a link
Code Example Good:
1. Home
  2. /
  3. Projects
  4. /
  5. Project Alpha
Code Example Bad: Home > Projects > Current // Plain text with no links or semantics
Accessibility: nav with aria-label=Breadcrumb; ol element; aria-current=page on last item; separators are aria-hidden
Responsive: Truncate middle items on mobile showing first and last; horizontal scroll if needed; smaller text on mobile

Description: Tab navigation for switching between content panels within the same context
Do: Use role=tablist/tab/tabpanel; show active tab clearly; arrow keys to navigate tabs; only active panel in DOM or use aria-hidden
Don't: Use tabs for page navigation; load all panels simultaneously without hiding; skip keyboard support
Code Example Good:
{tabs.map(tab => ())}
{activeContent}
Accessibility: role=tablist/tab/tabpanel; aria-selected; aria-controls; arrow key navigation; roving tabindex; only one tab in tab order
Responsive: Horizontal scroll for many tabs on mobile; consider dropdown for 5+ tabs on small screens; full-width tabs

Description: Page navigation for browsing through large datasets or content collections
Do: Use nav with aria-label=Pagination; show current page; disable prev/next at boundaries; provide page count
Don't: Show all page numbers for large sets; forget to disable boundary buttons; use only next/prev without context
Code Example Good:
{/* Previous */}
    • {/* Pages */}{pages.map(p => (
    • ))}
Accessibility: nav with aria-label; aria-current=page; aria-label on each button; disabled state on boundary; announce page changes
Responsive: Simplified pagination on mobile (prev/next + current/total); adequate tap targets; truncate middle pages

Description: Fixed bottom navigation bar for mobile-first apps with 3-5 main destinations
Do: Limit to 3-5 items; use icon + label; highlight active item; fixed to bottom; use nav element
Don't: Show more than 5 items; use text-only without icons; hide labels completely; make it scrollable
Code Example Good:
{items.map(item => (
  • {item.label}
    • ))}
Accessibility: nav with aria-label; aria-current=page; icon + text label; keyboard accessible; safe area padding for notch devices
Responsive: Only show on mobile (md:hidden); safe-area-inset-bottom padding; 3-5 items max; icon + label always

Description: Standard data table for displaying structured tabular data with proper semantics
Do: Use semantic table elements (table/thead/tbody/tr/th/td); add caption or aria-label; scope attributes on headers
Don't: Use divs for tabular data; skip thead; omit scope on headers; use tables for layout
Code Example Good:
{users.map(user => ())}
User list
NameEmailRole
{user.name}{user.email}{user.role}
Accessibility: Semantic table elements; caption or aria-label; scope=col/row on headers; screen readers announce cell position
Responsive: Horizontal scroll with sticky first column on mobile; card layout alternative for narrow screens

Description: Table with clickable column headers to sort data ascending/descending
Do: Use button inside th for sort triggers; show sort direction indicator; announce sort changes; use aria-sort
Don't: Sort without visual indicator; make entire header clickable without button semantics; lose sort state on re-render
Code Example Good: <th scope="col" aria-sort={sortCol === 'name' ? sortDir : 'none'}><button onClick={() => handleSort('name')} className="flex items-center gap-1 px-4 py-3 text-sm font-medium text-zinc-500 hover:text-zinc-900">Name {sortCol === 'name' && (sortDir === 'ascending' ? <ChevronUpIcon className="h-4 w-4" /> : <ChevronDownIcon className="h-4 w-4" />)}</button></th>
Accessibility: aria-sort on th (ascending/descending/none); button element for sort trigger; announce sort change to screen readers
Responsive: Prioritize sortable columns that fit on mobile; hide less important columns on small screens

Description: Table with filtering capabilities to narrow down displayed data
Do: Place filters above table; show active filter count; provide clear-all option; maintain filter state in URL
Don't: Hide filters behind multiple clicks; lose filter state on navigation; filter without feedback on result count
Code Example Good:
setSearch(e.target.value)} className="w-full rounded-lg border border-zinc-300 py-2 pl-9 pr-3 text-sm" />

{filtered.length} results
Code Example Bad:
{data.filter(magicFilter).map(...)}
// No UI for filtering, hidden logic
Accessibility: aria-label on filter inputs; announce result count changes with aria-live; filter controls labeled clearly
Responsive: Stack filters vertically on mobile; collapsible filter panel; full-width search input

Description: Table that adapts to small screens without losing data or context
Do: Use horizontal scroll container with sticky first column; or transform to card layout on mobile
Don't: Let table overflow without scroll; hide columns silently; force tiny font sizes on mobile
Code Example Good:
{/* rows */}
NameEmailStatus
Accessibility: Sticky column remains accessible; scroll indicator for horizontal overflow; announce table dimensions
Responsive: Horizontal scroll with shadow indicators; sticky first column; or card layout transformation below md

Description: Table with row selection checkboxes for batch operations on multiple items
Do: Provide select-all checkbox in header; show selected count; display batch action bar; use aria-selected
Don't: Mix selection with row click navigation; forget select-all; lose selection state on sort/filter
Code Example Good: Name{users.map(user => ( toggleRow(user.id)} className="h-4 w-4 rounded border-zinc-300" />{user.name}))}
Code Example Bad: toggleSelect(id)}>{name} // Click-only selection, no checkboxes
Accessibility: aria-selected on rows; labeled checkboxes; select-all with aria-label; announce selection count changes
Responsive: Checkbox column always visible; batch action bar fixed on mobile; adequate tap targets for checkboxes

Description: Success notification toast for confirming completed actions
Do: Auto-dismiss after 3-5 seconds; show at consistent position; include close button; use green/check styling
Don't: Block user interaction; show indefinitely for success; stack unlimited toasts; use only color to convey meaning
Code Example Good: Changes saved successfully
Accessibility: role=status; aria-live=polite; not just color (icon + text); close button with aria-label; announce to screen readers
Responsive: Fixed position (top-right on desktop, top-center on mobile); adequate width; swipe to dismiss on mobile

Description: Error notification toast for communicating failures that need user attention
Do: Do not auto-dismiss errors; require explicit close; provide actionable message; use red/error styling with icon
Don't: Auto-dismiss error messages; show vague error text; use only color without icon or text explanation
Code Example Good:
Payment failed

Please check your card details and try again.
Accessibility: role=alert for immediate announcement; do NOT auto-dismiss; descriptive message; close button with aria-label
Responsive: Persistent on screen; full-width on mobile; adequate padding for readability; retry action if applicable

Description: Warning notification for situations requiring user awareness but not immediate failure
Do: Use amber/yellow styling with warning icon; auto-dismiss in 5-8 seconds or keep persistent for important warnings; include action if applicable
Don't: Treat warnings same as errors; use alarming language for minor issues; dismiss too quickly
Code Example Good: Your session expires in 5 minutes
Accessibility: role=status; aria-live=polite; icon + text (not color-only); actionable when possible
Responsive: Full-width on mobile; action button easily tappable; adequate contrast for amber on white background

Description: Informational notification for non-critical updates and general messages
Do: Auto-dismiss in 5 seconds; use blue/neutral styling; keep message concise; position consistently with other toasts
Don't: Use info toasts for critical information; overuse for trivial updates; block user interaction
Code Example Good: New version available. Refresh to update.
Accessibility: role=status; aria-live=polite; icon + text; close button with aria-label
Responsive: Same positioning as other toasts; auto-dismiss appropriate; swipe to dismiss on mobile

Description: Dropdown menu triggered by a button showing a list of actions or options
Do: Use button trigger with aria-expanded; role=menu on container; role=menuitem on items; arrow key navigation; close on Escape
Don't: Open on hover without click option; forget to close on outside click; skip keyboard navigation
Code Example Good:
{open && (
)}
Accessibility: aria-haspopup; aria-expanded; role=menu/menuitem; arrow key navigation; Escape to close; focus first item on open
Responsive: Position menu to stay within viewport; full-width on mobile if needed; adequate tap targets for menu items

Description: Context menu appearing on right-click or long-press for contextual actions
Do: Use role=menu; position at cursor; close on outside click/Escape; provide keyboard alternative via button
Don't: Replace browser context menu entirely; forget to provide non-right-click alternative
Code Example Good:
{ e.preventDefault(); setMenuPos({ x: e.clientX, y: e.clientY }); setShowMenu(true); }}>{children}{showMenu && (
)}
Accessibility: role=menu/menuitem; position within viewport; keyboard accessible alternative; Escape to close
Responsive: Long-press trigger on touch devices; position within viewport bounds; adequate item height for touch

Description: Searchable select input combining text input with filtered dropdown list
Do: Use role=combobox; aria-autocomplete; filter options as user types; highlight matching text; keyboard navigation
Don't: Open dropdown without filtering; ignore keyboard navigation; lose focus on selection
Code Example Good:
setQuery(e.target.value)} onFocus={() => setOpen(true)} className="w-full rounded-lg border border-zinc-300 px-3 py-2 text-sm" />{open && filtered.length > 0 && (
    {filtered.map((opt, i) => (
  • selectOption(opt)}>{opt.label}
    • ))}
)}
Accessibility: role=combobox; aria-expanded; aria-autocomplete; role=listbox/option; aria-activedescendant; arrow keys + Enter to select
Responsive: Full-width on mobile; dropdown max-height with scroll; virtual keyboard should not obscure options

Description: Dropdown allowing multiple selections displayed as tags/chips in the input area
Do: Show selected items as removable tags; provide select-all option; show count for many selections; checkbox per option
Don't: Auto-close on each selection; hide selected items; no way to clear all selections
Code Example Good: {selected.map(item => ({item.label}))} setQuery(e.target.value)} className="min-w-[120px] flex-1 border-0 p-1 text-sm outline-none" />
Accessibility: Remove buttons with aria-label per tag; combobox ARIA pattern; announce selection changes; keyboard removable tags
Responsive: Tags wrap naturally; adequate tap targets for remove buttons; dropdown within viewport

Description: User avatar displaying profile image with fallback to initials or default icon
Do: Provide fallback for missing images; use consistent sizing; add alt text; show initials as fallback
Don't: Stretch non-square images; skip fallback; use low-res images at large sizes; forget alt text
Code Example Good: { e.currentTarget.style.display = 'none'; }} />{user.name.slice(0, 2).toUpperCase()}
Accessibility: alt text with user name; aria-hidden on decorative fallback; role=img if using div-based avatar
Responsive: Consistent sizes (24/32/40/48px); adequate resolution for retina; flexible for touch targets when clickable

Description: Small status indicator dot overlaid on avatar showing user availability or state
Do: Position consistently (bottom-right); use semantic colors (green=online, gray=offline); add sr-only label
Don't: Rely only on color for meaning; make badge too small; skip screen reader label
Code Example Good: {status === 'online' ? 'Online' : status === 'away' ? 'Away' : 'Offline'}
Accessibility: sr-only text describing status; not color-only (screen reader label); ring for visibility against backgrounds
Responsive: Badge scales with avatar size; visible on both light and dark backgrounds; adequate contrast

Description: Numeric or dot badge showing notification count or unread items on icons or avatars
Do: Show count for small numbers (1-99); show 99+ for large counts; use dot for boolean unread state; position top-right
Don't: Show exact large numbers (1234); make badge too small to read; skip screen reader announcement
Code Example Bad: {count}
Accessibility: Count in aria-label of parent; aria-hidden on visual badge; announce changes with aria-live for real-time updates
Responsive: Min badge size 20px; readable font size; consistent positioning across different icon sizes

Description: Small tooltip appearing on hover/focus to provide additional context for an element
Do: Show on hover and focus; position to stay in viewport; delay show by 200-300ms; hide immediately on leave; keep concise
Don't: Use tooltips for essential information; show on click blocking the element; make tooltips too long; nest interactive content
Code Example Good: Additional information about this field
Code Example Bad: Hover me // Native title with no styling or ARIA
Accessibility: role=tooltip; aria-describedby linking trigger to tooltip; show on focus for keyboard; concise text only
Responsive: Position to stay within viewport; consider replacing with inline text on mobile (no hover); touch-friendly alternative

Description: Rich popover with structured content appearing on click for more detailed information
Do: Trigger on click (not hover); include close button; trap focus if interactive; position within viewport
Don't: Open on hover for complex content; forget close mechanism; allow overflow off-screen
Code Example Good:
{open && (

Details

Detailed information with links and formatting.

)}
Accessibility: role=dialog for interactive popovers; aria-expanded on trigger; aria-controls; close on Escape; focus management
Responsive: Position within viewport; consider full-width on mobile; close button easily tappable

Description: Small info icon with tooltip for contextual help text next to form fields or labels
Do: Place next to the label it describes; use question mark or info icon; keep help text concise; trigger on hover and focus
Don't: Replace labels with info tooltips; hide critical instructions in tooltips; make tooltips the only way to learn usage
Accessibility: aria-describedby linking icon to tooltip; role=tooltip; show on focus; icon is focusable button
Responsive: Touch-friendly alternative: tap to show/hide; or always-visible hint text on mobile; adequate tap target for icon

Description: Skeleton loading placeholder mimicking card layout while content loads
Do: Match skeleton to actual content layout; use subtle animation (pulse or shimmer); show for predictable loading times
Don't: Show spinning loader instead of skeleton; mismatch skeleton with actual layout; flash skeleton for fast loads
Accessibility: aria-busy=true on container; aria-label describing loading state; hide from screen readers or announce loading
Responsive: Same dimensions as actual content to prevent layout shift; match responsive layout of real content

Description: Skeleton lines mimicking text content while loading paragraphs or descriptions
Do: Vary line widths to look natural; match actual text size and spacing; use consistent border-radius
Don't: Make all skeleton lines same width; use incorrect spacing; skip animation
Accessibility: aria-busy=true; aria-label; consistent animation that does not distract; hide individual lines from screen readers
Responsive: Match real text layout; line heights consistent with actual typography; responsive widths

Description: Full-screen or section-level loading overlay for blocking operations
Do: Use semi-transparent backdrop; show spinner or progress indicator; prevent interaction with underlying content; provide status text
Don't: Block without any visual indicator; trap focus permanently; show overlay for non-blocking operations
Code Example Good:
{children}

Processing...
Code Example Bad: Loading
Accessibility: aria-busy=true on container; status text for screen readers; focus management prevents interaction behind overlay
Responsive: Centered on viewport; readable status text; does not block critical navigation (like back button) on mobile

Description: Accordion where only one panel can be expanded at a time, collapsing others
Do: Use details/summary or custom with proper ARIA; animate open/close; show expand indicator; maintain focus on toggle
Don't: Allow all panels open simultaneously when single-expand is intended; lose scroll position on collapse
Code Example Good:
{items.map(item => (
{expanded === item.id && (
{item.content}
)}
))}
Accessibility: aria-expanded on trigger; aria-controls linking to panel; role=region on panel; Enter/Space to toggle; focus stays on trigger
Responsive: Full-width on all screens; smooth animation; adequate padding for touch targets on toggle buttons

Description: Accordion where multiple panels can be expanded independently of each other
Do: Allow any combination of open/closed panels; maintain individual state per panel; use Set or object for state
Don't: Use single-expand logic for multi-expand; re-render all panels on one toggle
Code Example Good:
{items.map(item => { const isOpen = expandedSet.has(item.id); return (
{isOpen && (
{item.content}
)}
); })}
Accessibility: Same ARIA as single-expand; each panel independent; aria-expanded per button; keyboard Enter/Space toggles
Responsive: Same responsive behavior as single accordion; panels stack naturally; smooth individual animations

Description: Structured FAQ section using accordion pattern for common questions and answers
Do: Use structured data (schema.org FAQ); organize by category; include search for large FAQs; link to individual questions
Don't: Dump all FAQs in a single flat list; skip structured data; hide critical information in collapsed panels
Code Example Good:
FAQ

{faqs.map(faq => (
{expanded === faq.id && (
{faq.answer}
)}
))}
Accessibility: Semantic accordion ARIA; structured data for SEO; search/filter for large lists; deep-linkable questions
Responsive: Full-width; adequate line-height for readability; touch-friendly toggle areas; smooth expand/collapse

Description: Image carousel/slider for showcasing multiple images with navigation controls
Do: Provide prev/next buttons; show pagination dots; support keyboard navigation; pause auto-play on hover/focus; lazy-load offscreen images
Don't: Auto-play without pause control; hide navigation controls; use only swipe (no buttons); load all images eagerly
Code Example Good:
{images.map((img, i) => (
))}
{images.map((_, i) => (
Code Example Bad: {images.map((img, i) => i === current && )}
Accessibility: aria-roledescription=carousel; role=group per slide with aria-roledescription=slide; aria-label per slide; prev/next labeled; pagination as tablist
Responsive: Swipe gesture support on touch; full-width on mobile; adequate button sizes; reduce auto-play to manual on mobile

Description: Carousel for cycling through customer testimonials and reviews
Do: Show one testimonial at a time; include avatar, name, and role; auto-play with pause; smooth transitions
Don't: Cram multiple testimonials in one view; use tiny text; skip attribution; auto-play too fast
Code Example Good:
“{testimonials[current].quote}”

{testimonials[current].name}

{testimonials[current].role}
Accessibility: aria-live=polite for content changes; blockquote for quote semantics; avatar alt empty if decorative
Responsive: Full-width on mobile; readable font size; adequate padding; swipe support; no auto-play on reduced-motion

Description: Horizontally scrolling carousel of cards for featured content or products
Do: Use scroll-snap for smooth snapping; show peek of next card; provide scroll indicators; support drag and swipe
Don't: Hide scrollbar without alternative navigation; snap too aggressively; forget overflow indicators
Code Example Good:
{items.map(item => (

{item.title}

{item.description}

))}
Accessibility: Navigation buttons with aria-label; scroll-snap for keyboard users; announce context on navigation
Responsive: Touch scroll native on mobile; snap-x snap-mandatory; peek of next card visible; adequate card widths

Description: Prominent search input with icon and optional clear button for content discovery
Do: Use type=search; show search icon; provide clear button when populated; submit on Enter; show recent searches
Don't: Auto-submit on every keystroke without debounce; hide search behind icon-only button; skip clear function
Code Example Good: <form role="search" action="/search" className="relative"><MagnifyingGlassIcon className="absolute left-3 top-1/2 h-5 w-5 -translate-y-1/2 text-zinc-400" /><input type="search" name="q" placeholder="Search..." aria-label="Search" value={query} onChange={e => setQuery(e.target.value)} className="w-full rounded-lg border border-zinc-300 bg-white py-2.5 pl-10 pr-10 text-sm shadow-sm transition-colors focus:border-blue-500 focus:ring-2 focus:ring-blue-500/20 dark:border-zinc-700 dark:bg-zinc-800" />{query && (<button type="button" onClick={() => setQuery('')} aria-label="Clear search" className="absolute right-3 top-1/2 -translate-y-1/2 rounded p-0.5 text-zinc-400 hover:text-zinc-600"><XMarkIcon className="h-4 w-4" /></button>)}</form>
Accessibility: role=search on form; type=search; aria-label; clear button with aria-label; submit on Enter
Responsive: Full-width on mobile; adequate font size (16px+) to prevent zoom; prominent placement; clear button tappable

Description: Keyboard-triggered command palette for power users to quickly navigate or execute actions
Do: Trigger with Cmd/Ctrl+K; fuzzy search; show keyboard shortcuts; group results by category; close on Escape
Don't: Require mouse to open; show all commands without filtering; lag on keystroke; skip keyboard navigation
Code Example Good:
setQuery(e.target.value)} className="flex-1 border-0 bg-transparent px-3 py-3 text-sm outline-none" />

  • {item.label}{item.shortcut}
    • ))}
Accessibility: role=listbox/option; aria-selected; autoFocus on input; arrow key navigation; Enter to execute; Escape to close
Responsive: Full-screen overlay on mobile; larger tap targets; simplified results; swipe to dismiss

Description: Search input with real-time suggestion dropdown as the user types
Do: Debounce API calls (200-300ms); highlight matching text in suggestions; show recent searches; keyboard navigable list
Don't: Fire API call on every keystroke; show stale results; ignore keyboard navigation in suggestions

Accessibility: role=combobox; aria-autocomplete=list; role=listbox/option; aria-activedescendant; arrow keys + Enter; Escape closes
Responsive: Full-width dropdown on mobile; suggestions within viewport; virtual keyboard does not obscure results; debounced input

Keywords: breadcrumb, path, trail, hierarchy, navigation, wayfinding
Description: Navigation breadcrumb showing current page location in hierarchy
Do: Use semantic nav with aria-label=Breadcrumb; ol/li structure; current page not a link; separator is decorative
Don't: Make breadcrumb the primary navigation; use as deep nesting (>4 levels); make current page clickable
Code Example Good:
1. Home
  2. /
  3. Products
  4. /
  5. Widget Pro
Accessibility: nav with aria-label=Breadcrumb; ol/li for semantic list; aria-current=page on last item; separators are aria-hidden
Responsive: Truncate middle items on mobile; show only parent + current on small screens

Keywords: skeleton, placeholder, loading, shimmer, pulse, content-loading
Description: Skeleton loading placeholder that mimics content layout during loading
Do: Match skeleton shapes to actual content (lines for text, circles for avatars, rectangles for images); use subtle pulse animation
Don't: Show generic spinner instead of content-shaped skeleton; make skeleton too different from final layout; skip aria-busy
Accessibility: aria-busy=true on container; aria-hidden on individual skeleton elements; screen reader announces loading state
Responsive: Same responsive layout as real content; skeleton adapts to container width

Description: Skeleton specifically shaped as a card with image, title, and description placeholders
Do: Mirror the exact card layout; consistent border-radius; subtle shimmer over pulse for premium feel
Don't: Use a completely different layout than the actual card; show spinner inside card shape
Accessibility: Same as Content Skeleton; aria-busy on card; preserve card dimensions to prevent layout shift
Responsive: Same card grid layout as real cards; responsive columns maintained

Keywords: empty, no-data, no-results, blank-state, zero-state, first-time
Description: Empty state shown when a list or table has no data to display
Do: Show relevant illustration/icon; explain why empty; provide clear CTA to populate data; be encouraging
Don't: Show nothing or just blank space; display technical error messages; blame the user
Code Example Good:
No items yet

Get started by creating your first item.
Accessibility: Ensure CTA button is keyboard accessible; use heading for empty state title; descriptive text for screen readers
Responsive: Center content on all screens; appropriate padding; CTA full-width on mobile

Description: Error state shown when data fetch or operation fails
Do: Show friendly error message; provide retry button; suggest alternative actions; log error details for debugging
Don't: Show raw error messages or stack traces; blame the user; offer no recovery path
Code Example Good:
Something went wrong

We could not load your data. Please try again.
Accessibility: role=alert for error announcement; retry button keyboard accessible; descriptive error for screen readers
Responsive: Same centering as No Data state; consistent padding and spacing

Keywords: command-palette, cmd-k, spotlight, quick-actions, omnibar, command-bar
Description: Keyboard-triggered command palette for quick navigation and action execution
Do: Trigger with Cmd/Ctrl+K; fuzzy search; show keyboard shortcuts; group results by category; close on Escape/click-outside
Don't: Require mouse to open; show all commands without filtering; lag on keystroke; skip keyboard navigation within results
Code Example Good:
{results.map((item, i) => (
  • {item.label}{item.shortcut}
    • ))}
Accessibility: role=listbox/option; aria-selected; autoFocus on input; arrow key navigation; Enter to execute; Escape to close
Responsive: Full-screen overlay on mobile; larger tap targets; simplified result grouping

Keywords: data-grid, sortable, filterable, table-advanced, column-sort, data-table
Description: Advanced data table with sortable columns, pagination, and optional filtering
Do: Add aria-sort on sortable headers; use button in th for sort trigger; show sort direction icon; maintain focus on sort
Don't: Sort without visual feedback; lose scroll position on sort; use anchor tags for sort headers
Code Example Good:
{rows.map(r => )}
{r.name}
Accessibility: aria-sort on active column; button inside th; keyboard accessible sorting; announce sort changes via aria-live
Responsive: Horizontal scroll with sticky first column on mobile; min-width on table

Keywords: drawer, sheet, side-panel, slide-out, off-canvas, sidebar-panel
Description: Slide-out panel from edge of screen for secondary content or forms
Do: Trap focus inside drawer; close on Escape; provide close button; overlay background; animate from edge
Don't: Open without overlay; don't trap focus; no close mechanism; content under drawer still interactive
Code Example Good:
Details

{children}
Accessibility: Focus trap; Escape to close; aria-label on close button; role=dialog; aria-modal=true
Responsive: Full-width on mobile (<640px); slide from bottom on small screens as bottom sheet

Keywords: tabs, tab-bar, tab-panel, segmented, horizontal-tabs, tab-navigation
Description: Horizontal tabbed interface for switching between related content panels
Do: Use role=tablist/tab/tabpanel; aria-selected on active tab; arrow keys for navigation; show one panel at a time
Don't: Use anchor navigation for tabs; show all panels; missing keyboard support; no aria roles
Code Example Good:
{tabs.map((tab, i) => ())}
{tabs[active].content}
Accessibility: role=tablist/tab/tabpanel; aria-selected; arrow key navigation between tabs; tabIndex management; aria-controls/labelledby
Responsive: Stack vertically on mobile or use horizontal scroll; full-width tabs on small screens

Description: Vertical tabbed interface typically used in settings or configuration pages
Do: Same ARIA roles as horizontal; use up/down arrow keys instead of left/right; clear active indicator
Don't: Mix horizontal and vertical tab keyboard patterns; use links instead of buttons for tabs
Code Example Good:
{tabs.map((tab, i) => ())}
{tabs[active].content}
Accessibility: aria-orientation=vertical; up/down arrow keys; same roles as horizontal tabs
Responsive: Collapse to horizontal tabs or accordion on mobile

Keywords: badge, status, tag, label, indicator, chip
Description: Small badge indicating status (active, inactive, pending, error)
Do: Use semantic colors consistently; keep text short (1-2 words); provide aria-label when color is the only differentiator
Don't: Use badge for long text; rely on color alone for meaning; make badges interactive without clear affordance
Code Example Good: Active
Accessibility: Don't rely on color alone; include text label; aria-label if meaning unclear from text alone
Responsive: Same size across breakpoints; consider wrapping in flex container

Keywords: notification, count, unread, dot, counter, indicator-badge
Description: Small counter or dot indicating unread notifications or pending items
Do: Keep count visible; use aria-label to describe count; cap display at 99+; position relative to icon
Don't: Make badge too large; show exact count over 99; skip accessibility annotation
Accessibility: aria-label on parent button with count; aria-hidden on visual badge; screen reader gets count from label
Responsive: Badge scales with icon; consistent positioning across screen sizes

Keywords: stepper, wizard, multi-step, progress, step-indicator, wizard-steps
Description: Step indicator for multi-step forms or wizards showing progress
Do: Number steps clearly; show completed/current/upcoming states; allow clicking completed steps to go back
Don't: Use only dots without labels; prevent going back to completed steps; no step count indicator
Code Example Good:
{steps.map((step, i) => (
  1. {i < current ? : i + 1}{step.label}{i < steps.length - 1 &&
    }
    2. ))}
Accessibility: nav with aria-label=Progress; ol/li for semantic list; aria-current=step on active; completed steps focusable
Responsive: Simplify to horizontal numbered list on mobile; show step X of Y

Keywords: alert, banner, notification-inline, message, callout, info-box
Description: Inline alert/callout for contextual feedback within the page
Do: Use role=alert for urgent messages; appropriate colors per type (info/success/warning/error); include dismiss option
Don't: Auto-dismiss important alerts; use alert for non-urgent info; place far from relevant content
Code Example Good:
New feature available

Check out the new dashboard analytics.
Accessibility: role=alert for important; role=status for informational; dismiss button with aria-label; icon is aria-hidden
Responsive: Full-width on mobile; consistent padding; stack icon and text vertically if very narrow

Description: Navigation for paginated data with page numbers and prev/next buttons
Do: Use nav with aria-label=Pagination; current page with aria-current=page; disable prev on first / next on last
Don't: Show too many page numbers; skip keyboard navigation; no indication of current page
Code Example Good: <nav aria-label="Pagination" className="flex items-center gap-1"><button disabled={page === 1} className="rounded-lg px-3 py-2 text-sm disabled:opacity-50" aria-label="Previous page">Prev</button>{pages.map(p => (<button key={p} aria-current={p === page ? 'page' : undefined} className={`rounded-lg px-3 py-2 text-sm ${p === page ? 'bg-blue-600 text-white' : 'hover:bg-zinc-100'}`}>{p}</button>))}<button disabled={page === totalPages} className="rounded-lg px-3 py-2 text-sm disabled:opacity-50" aria-label="Next page">Next</button></nav>
Accessibility: nav with aria-label; aria-current=page; disabled state on boundaries; keyboard accessible buttons
Responsive: Show fewer page numbers on mobile; prev/next always visible; consider mobile-friendly page selector

Description: Animated circular spinner indicating loading or processing state
Do: Use role=status with aria-label; keep spinner small and non-blocking; provide text alternative; use appropriate size
Don't: Use spinner as only feedback for long operations; block entire UI; show spinner without context
Code Example Good: Loading
Code Example Bad: <div className="animate-spin border-4 border-blue-600 rounded-full h-8 w-8" />
Accessibility: role=status; aria-label=Loading; sr-only text; prefers-reduced-motion: show static indicator
Responsive: Size variants: sm (16px) md (20px) lg (32px); consistent across breakpoints

Description: Component that catches render errors and displays fallback UI instead of crashing
Do: Show user-friendly message; provide retry/reload button; log error to monitoring service; preserve layout
Don't: Show white screen; expose stack traces to users; lose all state without recovery option
Code Example Good:
Something went wrong

An unexpected error occurred.

}>{children}
Code Example Bad: /* No error boundary â€” app crashes to white screen */
Accessibility: Fallback UI must be keyboard accessible; aria-live for error announcement; preserve navigation if possible
Responsive: Same responsive behavior as normal content; centered fallback on all screens

Description: Custom 404 page shown when a route doesn't exist
Do: Show friendly message; provide search or navigation options; match site design; include link to home
Don't: Show default browser 404; expose server details; provide no way back; show blank page
Code Example Good:
404

Page not found

The page you are looking for does not exist or has been moved.

Go homeSearch
Accessibility: Semantic heading structure; links keyboard accessible; descriptive title for screen readers
Responsive: Centered on all screens; appropriate spacing; buttons stack on mobile
